metadata.Title: CVE-2023-32637 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description: GBrowse accepts files with any formats uploaded and places them in the area accessible through unauthenticated web requests. Therefore, anyone who can upload files through the product may execute arbitrary code on the server.

notes.Note: ccdm94> this has likely been fixed in all 2.x versions.

criterions.comment: gbrowse: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
